title: Initial project structure
summary: Created initial project layout and core files.

title: Launched blog section
summary: Added initial blog scaffolding and content structure.

title: Add Coolify local run steps
summary: Documented how to run the website locally using Coolify.

title: README overhaul and monorepo layout
summary: Rewrote README with monorepo layout, setup guidance, and best practices.

title: Switch to Google Fonts for Outfit
summary: Temporarily moved to Google Fonts for Outfit with corrected crossorigin usage (later replaced by self‑hosting).

title: Licensing overhaul (AGPL + CC BY 4.0)
summary: Adopted AGPL-3.0-or-later for software and CC BY 4.0 for posts/images/docs/data; added NOTICE, LICENSES.md, and per-file SPDX headers.

title: Show Source & License in UI/API
summary: Advertise source and license via UI header and API Link headers to comply with AGPL §13.

title: Docs: Coolify‑first deployment
summary: Simplified README to focus on Docker/Coolify as the best‑supported deployment path; removed other paths.

title: Updates page + navigation
summary: Added a new Updates page that renders /data/updates.json and a header nav link so changes are easy to follow.

title: Self‑host fonts + network optimizations
summary: Reduced third‑party requests and improved reliability by self‑hosting fonts and optimizing asset loading.

title: Popup image fallback
summary: Ensure placeholder shows when images are missing or fail to load.

title: Chromium scrollbar polish
summary: Dark, thin scrollbars for popups and lists on Chrome/Edge; Firefox kept tidy.

title: Prevent wrap of 'More' pills
summary: Stops the header's 'More' pills from wrapping onto multiple lines by enforcing white-space: nowrap on pill items. This keeps the navigation tidy and improves readability on smaller screens.

title: Center header and filter styling
summary: Center the Updates page heading/lead and style the filter UI to match the Limits page (centered layout at 720px). This improves readability on smaller screens and provides a consistent look across data-driven pages.

title: Keep search icon inside input
summary: Keeps the magnifier icon inside the search field and adds a wrapper with max-width and extra right padding. This improves alignment and touch targets on smaller screens.

title: Keep decorative glow disabled in High Contrast
summary: Disables decorative glow in Windows High Contrast mode to maintain a clean, readable UI.

title: Center glow strengthened across pages
summary: Center the glow effect and increase its strength by about 20% across all pages. This enhances visual emphasis and consistency of the Wave-Finder branding, improving perceived depth and polish for users.

title: Global glow wired across pages
summary: Introduced a single, global background glow stylesheet at /static/wf-glow.css and wired the glow effect uniformly across all pages for consistent visuals. This ensures visual cohesion and reduces divergence as new sections are added.

title: Markdown parsing upgraded to marked.js
summary: Replaced the in-house markdown parser with marked.js v11.1.1 (MIT licensed). The library is now hosted locally under /static/ to remove external dependencies. Markdown support is now complete: tables, strikethrough, nested lists, and code blocks render correctly. Updated the LICENSE attribution for marked.js to reflect the new dependency.

title: Refresh updates page layout and navigation
summary: Updated the Updates page to refine its layout and navigation. This makes it easier for users to read the changelog and click through to the commit details for each update.

title: Add comprehensive blog creator with ZIP
summary: Adds a comprehensive blog creator with a dual-pane markdown editor and live preview powered by marked.js, plus an image upload system with a clean placeholder workflow and cover image preview. Introduces ZIP packaging of complete blog posts and ZIP loading to resume editing, with locally hosted JSZip (v3.10.1) and marked.js (v11.1.1). Includes full project state management (clear all, load, save), MIT license compliance, and attribution across the blog tooling. Features metadata forms, tag management, a complete round-trip editing workflow, robust error handling, and memory-leak protection for image URLs.

title: Blog creation tool in progress
summary: Begins introducing a blog creation tool that will let users draft and submit their own blogs from the site. The feature is still in development and may be refined as the workflow is implemented.

title: Fix blog creator preview function and improve UI
summary: Fixes JavaScript syntax errors in the blog preview to stop code rendering as text, simplifies template logic by replacing complex template literals with straightforward string concatenation, and updates the preview to match the exact post.html styling and structure for accurate live previews. Replaces the preview button icon with clear 'Preview' text for better UX. Ensures the preview shows an identical appearance to live blog posts and resolves script tag escaping issues in the preview generation.

title: Replace prompts with custom modal system
summary: Added a custom modal system with Wave Finder styling and animations, replacing all alert() calls with showAlert() modals and replacing all confirm() calls with showConfirm() modals. Fixed issue where users could disable browser prompts, and enhanced UX with backdrop blur, keyboard support, and click-outside-to-close, with modals matching the site's dark theme and accent colors. Improved accessibility with focus management and ESC key support, and added async support for confirm dialogs in clearAll() and resetForm().

title: Self-host critical JavaScript libraries
summary: Self-hosted critical frontend libraries to remove external CDN dependencies. Added Leaflet v1.9.4 (leaflet.css, leaflet.js, map icons) and jsPDF v2.5.1 (jspdf.umd.min.js) with proper attribution. Updated index.html and records.html to serve Leaflet/JS locally and removed unnecessary preconnect/dns-prefetch to external CDNs. Benefits include zero external dependencies, faster loading, improved privacy, offline capability, and license-compliant attribution. Total self-hosted libraries ~514KB; external dependencies eliminated: unpkg.com, cdnjs.cloudflare.com.

title: Update About page content
summary: Updated the about.html page to reflect the latest branding, project goals and team information. This improves accuracy and helps visitors understand Wave Finder's purpose at a glance. Minor wording tweaks to improve readability.

title: Sanitize blog markdown and harden preview
summary: Sanitize markdown in the blog creator and harden the live preview to prevent raw code from appearing. Ensure links and images are safely rendered to avoid unsafe content. Fix the JSZip path used for blog export/import so packages load correctly. Strengthen modal and tag safety to reduce user errors during blog creation.

title: Harden blog preview security
summary: Added security attributes to all preview links (noopener, noreferrer, and opener=null) to prevent tabnabbing and window.opener exploits. Validate cover image preview src to ensure only safe images are rendered in the blog creator preview. Introduced click guards to block unsafe protocols in preview interactions, reducing risk of navigation to unintended schemes.

title: Sanitize blog content: allow tables and code
summary: Enhances blog content sanitization by allowing tables and del elements via a secure allowlist. Also permits class attributes on pre, code, and table elements to preserve styling in previews. This reduces security risks (XSS) while keeping essential formatting intact for user posts.

title: Index page layout updated for consistency
summary: Updated the index.html file to align with recent design updates and ensure consistency with the site’s styling and navigation. This improves visual coherence on the home page and lays groundwork for upcoming UI changes.

title: Leaflet.js updated for map compatibility
summary: Updated the Leaflet.js library file in the maps module to the latest version. This helps improve map rendering and interaction with current browsers. Keeping dependencies up to date reduces potential security issues and ensures compatibility with future features.

title: Normalize font usage and update header styles
summary: Standardized font-family across all HTML pages to prefer 'OutfitLocal' and self-hosted 'Outfit' with system fallbacks. Updated /static/fonts/outfit.css to alias 'Outfit' to local WOFF2 files. Updated /static/wf-header.css to inherit the site-wide font. Bumped wf-header.css version in all HTML files to ensure style updates are applied.

title: Update header styles with wf-header.css
summary: Updated wf-header.css to refresh the site header styling across pages. This helps maintain consistency with the latest design updates and improves visual polish for users.

title: Update wf-header.css for header styling
summary: Updated wf-header.css to apply the latest header styling changes. This improves header alignment and visual consistency across pages and viewport sizes. The change helps ensure the updated header visuals are loaded consistently site-wide.

title: Remove scrollbar-gutter CSS from header styles
summary: Removed the scrollbar-gutter property from wf-header.css, which was used to reserve space for scrollbars and prevent layout shifts. This change may affect content centering on pages with or without scrollbars.

title: Fix header centering by updating left property
summary: Changed the #wf-header left property from 50% to 50vw to improve centering across different viewport sizes. This fixes misalignment on narrower or wider layouts.

title: Refactor header styles to use shared CSS file
summary: Removed inline header and navigation styles from multiple HTML files and replaced them with a shared /static/wf-header.css stylesheet. This centralizes header styling for easier maintenance and consistency across the web app.

title: Update wf-header.css for header alignment
summary: Updated wf-header.css to refresh header styling and alignment across pages. This change improves the consistency of the site header and reduces layout shifts as the UI evolves.

title: Scroll Bar and Transparent bug fix
summary: Fixed a bug affecting scrollbar rendering and header transparency in the Wave Finder header. The scrollbar could shift the header layout or appear misaligned when content changed, and the header's translucent elements could render inconsistently across pages. This update makes scrolling visuals stable and improves header readability across the site. It touched wf-header.css and wf-header.js to apply the fix site-wide.
